trans-unit.source: Creates a new primary or impersonation access token that duplicates an existing token

seg-source.mrk: Creates a new primary or impersonation access token that duplicates an existing token

target.mrk: Creates a new primary or impersonation access token that duplicates an existing token

trans-unit.source: A handle to an access token opened with $TOKEN_DUPLICATE access.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to an access token opened with $TOKEN_DUPLICATE access.

target.mrk: A handle to an access token opened with $TOKEN_DUPLICATE access.

trans-unit.source: The requested access rights for the new token. To request the same access rights as the existing token, specify zero.

seg-source.mrk: The requested access rights for the new token.
To request the same access rights as the existing token, specify zero.

target.mrk: The requested access rights for the new token.
To request the same access rights as the existing token, specify zero.

trans-unit.source: To request all access rights that are valid for the caller, specify the $TOKEN_ALL_ACCESS access.

seg-source.mrk: To request all access rights that are valid for the caller, specify the $TOKEN_ALL_ACCESS access.

target.mrk: To request all access rights that are valid for the caller, specify the $TOKEN_ALL_ACCESS access.

trans-unit.source: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new token and determines whether child processes can inherit the token.

seg-source.mrk: $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new token and determines whether child processes can inherit the token.

target.mrk: $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new token and determines whether child processes can inherit the token.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the token gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the token gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the token gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.

trans-unit.source: If the security descriptor contains a system access control list, the token gets $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right, even if it was not requested.

seg-source.mrk: If the security descriptor contains a system access control list, the token gets $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right, even if it was not requested.

target.mrk: If the security descriptor contains a system access control list, the token gets $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right, even if it was not requested.

trans-unit.source: The handle to the new token.

seg-source.mrk: The handle to the new token.

target.mrk: The handle to the new token.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished using the new token, call the _WinAPI_CloseHandle() function to close the token handle.

seg-source.mrk: When you have finished using the new token, call the _WinAPI_CloseHandle() function to close the token handle.

target.mrk: When you have finished using the new token, call the _WinAPI_CloseHandle() function to close the token handle.
